  1 | # Terminal Custom Setup
  2 | 
  3 | Automated terminal and development environment setup for Nobara 42 / Fedora.
  4 | 
  5 | ## Features
  6 | 
  7 | - **Shell Environment**: Zsh, Starship prompt, Atuin history, Fastfetch
  8 | - **Terminal**: Kitty GPU-accelerated terminal with Catppuccin theme
  9 | - **Fonts**: Nerd Fonts (CaskaydiaCove, FiraCode, JetBrains Mono)
 10 | - **Tmux**: Multiplexer with TPM plugins, session persistence
 11 | - **Power Tools**: zoxide, eza, bat, fzf, ripgrep, fd-find, lazygit, yazi
 12 | - **Containers**: Podman & Podman Compose
 13 | - **VS Code**: Installation, extensions, and settings restoration
 14 | - **Qdrant**: Vector database with auto-start systemd service
 15 | - **Godot Engine**: Game engine with VS Code integration
 16 | - **Additional Apps**: Chrome, Dropbox, Discord, Obsidian, Anki
 17 | - **OneDrive**: Multi-account support via `abraunegg/onedrive` client
 18 | - **Audio Processing**: EasyEffects with pre-tuned presets and autoload rules
 19 | - **Cisco Packet Tracer**: Network simulation tool
 20 | - **Vietnamese Input**: ibus-bamboo for Vietnamese typing
 21 | 
 22 | ## Quick Start
 23 | 
 24 | ```bash
 25 | # Clone the repository
 26 | git clone <repo-url> terminal-custom
 27 | cd terminal-custom
 28 | 
 29 | # Full installation
 30 | ./setup.sh
 31 | 
 32 | # Or minimal (core only)
 33 | ./setup.sh --minimal
 34 | ```
 35 | 
 36 | ## Usage
 37 | 
 38 | ```bash
 39 | ./setup.sh [OPTIONS]
 40 | 
 41 | Options:
 42 |   --minimal           Core setup only (shell, dotfiles, fonts)
 43 |   --full              Run full standard setup (useful to combine with --enhance)
 44 |   --enhance           Install power tools (zoxide, eza, bat, fzf, ripgrep, fd-find, lazygit, yazi)
 45 |   --skip-vscode       Skip VS Code installation
 46 |   --skip-qdrant       Skip Qdrant setup
 47 |   --skip-godot        Skip Godot installation
 48 |   --skip-apps         Skip additional apps (Chrome, Dropbox, Flatpaks)
 49 |   --skip-packettracer Skip Cisco Packet Tracer installation
 50 |   --skip-easyeffects  Skip EasyEffects audio setup
 51 |   --onedrive          Setup OneDrive (supports multiple accounts)
 52 |   --vietnamese        Install Vietnamese input method (ibus-bamboo)
 53 |   --help              Show help message
 54 | 
 55 | Exclusive Mode (Run ONLY specific components):
 56 |   ./setup.sh --vscode                     # ONLY install VS Code
 57 |   ./setup.sh --qdrant                     # ONLY setup Qdrant
 58 |   ./setup.sh --godot                      # ONLY install Godot
 59 |   ./setup.sh --apps                       # ONLY install Apps
 60 |   ./setup.sh --packettracer               # ONLY install Packet Tracer
 61 |   ./setup.sh --easyeffects                # ONLY setup EasyEffects
 62 |   ./setup.sh --core --enhance             # Core setup + Enhancement ONLY
 63 | 
 64 | Examples:
 65 |   ./setup.sh                              # Full installation
 66 |   ./setup.sh --minimal                    # Core setup only
 67 |   ./setup.sh --enhance                    # Add power tools to existing setup (Exclusive mode)
 68 |   ./setup.sh --full --enhance             # Full setup + Enhancement
 69 |   ./setup.sh --skip-godot --skip-apps     # Skip Godot and apps
 70 | ```
 71 | 
 72 | ## Project Structure
 73 | 
 74 | ```
 75 | .
 76 | ├── setup.sh                    # Master orchestrator script
 77 | ├── assets/                     # Configuration data and assets
 78 | │   ├── .zshrc, .bashrc, .gitconfig
 79 | │   ├── .config/                # App configs (starship, atuin, fastfetch, kitty)
 80 | │   ├── fonts/                  # Nerd Fonts collection
 81 | │   ├── godot/                  # Godot editor settings
 82 | │   ├── vscode/                 # VS Code settings and extensions
 83 | │   ├── images/                 # Custom assets (fastfetch logo)
 84 | │   └── CiscoPacketTracer*.deb  # Packet Tracer installer (optional)
 85 | └── scripts/
 86 |     ├── common.sh               # Shared utilities and logging
 87 |     ├── terminal_setup.sh       # Combined terminal setup (core + enhancements)
 88 |     ├── vscode_setup.sh         # VS Code installation and configuration
 89 |     ├── qdrant_setup.sh         # Qdrant vector database with Podman
 90 |     ├── godot_setup.sh          # Godot Engine installation
 91 |     ├── apps_setup.sh           # Chrome, Dropbox, Flatpak apps
 92 |     ├── onedrive_setup.sh       # OneDrive multi-account setup
 93 |     ├── easyeffects_setup.sh    # EasyEffects audio presets and configuration
 94 |     ├── packettracer_setup.sh   # Cisco Packet Tracer installation
 95 |     └── input_setup.sh          # Vietnamese input method (ibus-bamboo)
 96 | ```
 97 | 
 98 | ## What Gets Installed
 99 | 
100 | ### Terminal Setup (`terminal_setup.sh`)
101 | 
102 | **Core Setup** (`--core`):
103 | - System update (dnf)
104 | - Packages: zsh, git, curl, wget, util-linux-user, fastfetch, kitty, podman, podman-compose, tmux
105 | - Starship prompt, Atuin shell history
106 | - Zsh plugins: autosuggestions, syntax-highlighting, autocomplete
107 | - Dotfiles: .zshrc, .bashrc, .gitconfig
108 | - Config directories: starship, atuin, fastfetch, kitty, tmux
109 | - Fonts installed to ~/.local/share/fonts
110 | - Default shell changed to Zsh
111 | 
112 | **Enhancement** (`--enhance`):
113 | - **Power Tools**:
114 |   - `zoxide` - Smart cd replacement (learns your directories)
115 |   - `eza` - Modern ls with icons, colors, and git status
116 |   - `bat` - Cat with syntax highlighting
117 |   - `fzf` - Fuzzy finder with Catppuccin theme
118 |   - `ripgrep` - Fast grep alternative
119 |   - `fd-find` - Fast find alternative
120 |   - `lazygit` - Terminal UI for git
121 |   - `yazi` - Terminal file manager with image preview
122 | - **Tmux Plugins** (via TPM):
123 |   - Catppuccin theme
124 |   - tmux-resurrect (save/restore sessions)
125 |   - tmux-continuum (auto-save sessions)
126 |   - tmux-yank (system clipboard)
127 | - **Enhanced Configs**:
128 |   - `.zshrc.enhanced` with aliases and tool integrations
129 |   - `kitty.conf.enhanced` with CaskaydiaCove Nerd Font & Catppuccin
130 |   - `tmux.conf.enhanced` with TPM and Catppuccin theme
131 |   - `starship-catppuccin.toml` optional Catppuccin starship theme
132 | 
133 | **New Aliases After Enhancement:**
134 | ```bash
135 | ls  → eza --icons              # List with icons
136 | ll  → eza -la --icons --git    # Detailed list with git status
137 | lt  → eza --tree               # Tree view
138 | cat → bat                       # Syntax highlighted cat
139 | lg  → lazygit                   # Git TUI
140 | y   → yazi                      # File manager (cd on exit)
141 | z   → zoxide                    # Smart directory jumping
142 | ```
143 | 
144 | ### VS Code Setup (`vscode_setup.sh`)
145 | - VS Code installation via Microsoft repo
146 | - Settings and keybindings restoration
147 | - Extensions installation from extensions.txt
148 | - Kilo Code global storage restoration
149 | 
150 | ### Qdrant Setup (`qdrant_setup.sh`)
151 | - Podman container setup
152 | - Systemd user service (auto-start on boot)
153 | - Available at http://localhost:6333
154 | 
155 | ### Godot Setup (`godot_setup.sh`)
156 | - Downloads Godot (default: 4.5.1, configurable via `GODOT_VERSION` env var)
157 | - Installs to ~/.local/bin/godot
158 | - Restores editor settings with VS Code integration
159 | - Creates desktop entry
160 | 
161 | ### Apps Setup (`apps_setup.sh`)
162 | - Google Chrome (DNF)
163 | - Dropbox (DNF)
164 | - Discord, Obsidian, Anki (Flatpak)
165 | 
166 | ### OneDrive Setup (`onedrive_setup.sh`)
167 | - Installs `abraunegg/onedrive` client
168 | - Interactive setup for multiple accounts (e.g., Personal, Work)
169 | - Creates isolated configurations in `~/.config/onedrive-<name>`
170 | - Sets up systemd user services for automatic sync (`onedrive@<name>`)
171 | 
172 | ### Packet Tracer Setup (`packettracer_setup.sh`)
173 | - Converts Ubuntu .deb package for Fedora
174 | - Installs Qt5 dependencies
175 | - Non-interactive installation
176 | 
177 | ### EasyEffects Audio Setup (`easyeffects_setup.sh`)
178 | - Installs EasyEffects via DNF
179 | - Restores audio presets and configuration from `assets/.config/easyeffects` into `~/.config/easyeffects`
180 | - If Flatpak EasyEffects is installed, also syncs presets to `~/.var/app/com.github.wwmm.easyeffects/config/easyeffects`
181 | - Includes pre-tuned output presets (e.g., G560 speakers, G435 headset)
182 | - Includes autoload rules so presets switch automatically based on the active audio device
183 | 
184 | ### Vietnamese Input Setup (`input_setup.sh`)
185 | - Installs ibus and ibus-bamboo
186 | - Configures IBus environment variables
187 | - Supports Telex typing method (default)
188 | 
189 | ## Individual Script Usage
190 | 
191 | You can run individual scripts directly:
192 | 
193 | ```bash
194 | # Run core terminal setup
195 | bash scripts/terminal_setup.sh --core
196 | 
197 | # Run only terminal enhancement
198 | bash scripts/terminal_setup.sh --enhance
199 | 
200 | # Run only VS Code setup
201 | bash scripts/vscode_setup.sh
202 | 
203 | # Run only Qdrant setup
204 | bash scripts/qdrant_setup.sh
205 | 
206 | # Install Godot with specific version
207 | GODOT_VERSION=4.3 bash scripts/godot_setup.sh
208 | 
209 | # Uninstall Godot
210 | bash scripts/godot_setup.sh --uninstall
211 | 
212 | # Uninstall Packet Tracer
213 | bash scripts/packettracer_setup.sh --uninstall
214 | 
215 | # Run only EasyEffects audio setup
216 | bash scripts/easyeffects_setup.sh
217 | 
218 | # Install Vietnamese input
219 | bash scripts/input_setup.sh
220 | 
221 | # Setup OneDrive
222 | bash scripts/onedrive_setup.sh
223 | ```
224 | 
225 | ## Post-Enhancement Setup
226 | 
227 | After running `./setup.sh --enhance`, complete these steps:
228 | 
229 | 1. **Restart terminal** or run `source ~/.zshrc`
230 | 
231 | 2. **Install tmux plugins**: Open tmux and press `Ctrl+a` then `I` (capital i)
232 | 
233 | 3. **Optional - Use Catppuccin Starship theme**:
234 |    ```bash
235 |    cp ~/.config/starship/starship-catppuccin.toml ~/.config/starship.toml
236 |    ```
237 | 
238 | 4. **Zoxide**: Just start using `z` command - it learns your directories automatically
239 | 
240 | 5. **FZF keybindings**:
241 |    - `Ctrl+R` - Search command history
242 |    - `Ctrl+T` - Search files
243 |    - `Alt+C` - cd to directory
244 | 
245 | ## Requirements
246 | 
247 | - Nobara 42 or Fedora-based distribution
248 | - User with sudo access
249 | - Internet connection
250 | 
251 | ## Legacy Scripts
252 | 
253 | Previous installation scripts are preserved in `terminal_backup/` for reference:
254 | - `install.sh` - Original all-in-one script
255 | - `install_apps.sh` - Original apps installer
256 | - `install_godot.sh` - Original Godot installer
257 | - `install_packettracer.sh` - Original Packet Tracer installer
258 | 
259 | ## License
260 | 
261 | Personal configuration backup - use at your own discretion.

  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # =============================================================================
  3 | # common.sh - Shared utilities for terminal-custom setup scripts
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | 
  6 | # Resolve paths
  7 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
  8 | PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/.." && pwd)"
  9 | BACKUP_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/assets"
 10 | 
 11 | # Colors
 12 | RED='\033[0;31m'
 13 | GREEN='\033[0;32m'
 14 | YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
 15 | BLUE='\033[0;34m'
 16 | CYAN='\033[0;36m'
 17 | BOLD='\033[1m'
 18 | NC='\033[0m' # No Color
 19 | 
 20 | # =============================================================================
 21 | # Logging Functions
 22 | # =============================================================================
 23 | 
 24 | log_info() {
 25 |     echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
 26 | }
 27 | 
 28 | log_success() {
 29 |     echo -e "${GREEN}[✓]${NC} $1"
 30 | }
 31 | 
 32 | log_warn() {
 33 |     echo -e "${YELLOW}[!]${NC} $1"
 34 | }
 35 | 
 36 | log_error() {
 37 |     echo -e "${RED}[✗]${NC} $1"
 38 | }
 39 | 
 40 | log_section() {
 41 |     echo ""
 42 |     echo -e "${GREEN}${BOLD}>>> $1${NC}"
 43 | }
 44 | 
 45 | # =============================================================================
 46 | # Utility Functions
 47 | # =============================================================================
 48 | 
 49 | # Create directory if it doesn't exist
 50 | ensure_dir() {
 51 |     local dir="$1"
 52 |     if [[ ! -d "$dir" ]]; then
 53 |         mkdir -p "$dir"
 54 |         log_success "Created directory: $dir"
 55 |     fi
 56 | }
 57 | 
 58 | # Check if a command exists
 59 | check_command() {
 60 |     command -v "$1" &> /dev/null
 61 | }
 62 | 
 63 | # Run command with sudo, non-interactive
 64 | run_sudo() {
 65 |     sudo "$@"
 66 | }
 67 | 
 68 | # Install packages via dnf (non-interactive)
 69 | dnf_install() {
 70 |     sudo dnf install -y "$@"
 71 | }
 72 | 
 73 | # Check if running as root (we don't want that)
 74 | check_not_root() {
 75 |     if [[ $EUID -eq 0 ]]; then
 76 |         log_error "Do not run this script as root. Use a regular user with sudo access."
 77 |         exit 1
 78 |     fi
 79 | }
 80 | 
 81 | # Verify backup directory exists
 82 | verify_backup_dir() {
 83 |     if [[ ! -d "$BACKUP_DIR" ]]; then
 84 |         log_error "Backup directory not found: $BACKUP_DIR"
 85 |         exit 1
 86 |     fi
 87 | }
 88 | 
 89 | # Copy file with backup of existing
 90 | copy_with_backup() {
 91 |     local src="$1"
 92 |     local dest="$2"
 93 |     
 94 |     if [[ -f "$dest" ]]; then
 95 |         cp "$dest" "${dest}.backup.$(date +%Y%m%d%H%M%S)"
 96 |         log_warn "Backed up existing: $dest"
 97 |     fi
 98 |     
 99 |     cp "$src" "$dest"
100 |     log_success "Copied: $src -> $dest"
101 | }
102 | 
103 | # Copy directory recursively
104 | copy_dir() {
105 |     local src="$1"
106 |     local dest="$2"
107 |     
108 |     ensure_dir "$dest"
109 |     cp -r "$src"/* "$dest"/ 2>/dev/null || true
110 |     log_success "Copied directory: $src -> $dest"
111 | }
112 | 
113 | # =============================================================================
114 | # Export for sourcing
115 | # =============================================================================
116 | export SCRIPT_DIR PROJECT_ROOT BACKUP_DIR
117 | export RED GREEN YELLOW BLUE CYAN BOLD NC
</content>

 1 | #!/bin/bash
 2 | # =============================================================================
 3 | # vscode_setup.sh - VS Code installation and configuration
 4 | # =============================================================================
 5 | 
 6 | set -e
 7 | 
 8 | # Source common utilities
 9 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
10 | source "$SCRIPT_DIR/common.sh"
11 | 
12 | check_not_root
13 | verify_backup_dir
14 | 
15 | VSCODE_USER_DIR="$HOME/.config/Code/User"
16 | VSCODE_GLOBAL_STORAGE="$HOME/.config/Code/User/globalStorage"
17 | 
18 | # =============================================================================
19 | # Install VS Code
20 | # =============================================================================
21 | log_section "Installing VS Code..."
22 | 
23 | if check_command code; then
24 |     log_success "VS Code is already installed"
25 | else
26 |     log_info "VS Code not found, installing..."
27 |     
28 |     # Import Microsoft GPG key
29 |     sudo rpm --import https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc
30 |     
31 |     # Add VSCode repository
32 |     echo -e "[code]\nname=Visual Studio Code\nbaseurl=https://packages.microsoft.com/yumrepos/vscode\nenabled=1\ngpgcheck=1\ngpgkey=https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc" | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/vscode.repo > /dev/null
33 |     
34 |     sudo dnf check-update || true
35 |     dnf_install code
36 |     log_success "VS Code installed"
37 | fi
38 | 
39 | # =============================================================================
40 | # Restore VS Code Settings
41 | # =============================================================================
42 | log_section "Restoring VS Code settings..."
43 | ensure_dir "$VSCODE_USER_DIR"
44 | 
45 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/settings.json" ]]; then
46 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/settings.json" "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/"
47 |     log_success "settings.json restored"
48 | fi
49 | 
50 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/keybindings.json" ]]; then
51 |     cp "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/keybindings.json" "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/"
52 |     log_success "keybindings.json restored"
53 | fi
54 | 
55 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/snippets" ]]; then
56 |     ensure_dir "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/snippets"
57 |     cp -r "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/snippets/"* "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/snippets/"
58 |     log_success "snippets restored"
59 | fi
60 | 
61 | # =============================================================================
62 | # Install VS Code Extensions
63 | # =============================================================================
64 | if [[ -f "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/extensions.txt" ]]; then
65 |     log_section "Installing VS Code extensions..."
66 |     
67 |     while IFS= read -r extension || [[ -n "$extension" ]]; do
68 |         if [[ -n "$extension" && ! "$extension" =~ ^# ]]; then
69 |             log_info "Installing: $extension"
70 |             code --install-extension "$extension" --force 2>/dev/null || log_warn "Failed to install: $extension"
71 |         fi
72 |     done < "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/extensions.txt"
73 |     
74 |     log_success "VS Code extensions installation complete"
75 | fi
76 | 
77 | # =============================================================================
78 | # Restore Global Storage (Kilo Code, etc.)
79 | # =============================================================================
80 | if [[ -d "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code" ]]; then
81 |     log_section "Restoring Kilo Code configuration..."
82 |     ensure_dir "$VSCODE_GLOBAL_STORAGE"
83 |     cp -r "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code" "$VSCODE_GLOBAL_STORAGE/"
84 |     log_success "Kilo Code global storage restored"
85 | fi
86 | 
87 | log_section "VS Code setup complete!"
</content>

  1 | #!/bin/bash
  2 | # =============================================================================
  3 | # godot_setup.sh - Godot Engine installation and configuration
  4 | # =============================================================================
  5 | 
  6 | set -e
  7 | 
  8 | # Source common utilities
  9 | SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
 10 | source "$SCRIPT_DIR/common.sh"

 16 | GODOT_VERSION="${GODOT_VERSION:-4.5.1}"
 17 | GODOT_INSTALL_DIR="$HOME/.local/bin"
 18 | GODOT_CONFIG_DIR="$HOME/.config/godot"
 19 | 
 20 | # =============================================================================
 21 | # Handle Uninstall
 22 | # =============================================================================
 23 | if [[ "$1" == "--uninstall" ]]; then
 24 |     log_section "Uninstalling Godot..."
 25 |     rm -f "$GODOT_INSTALL_DIR/godot"
 26 |     rm -f "$HOME/.local/share/applications/godot.desktop"
 27 |     log_success "Godot uninstalled (config preserved in ~/.config/godot)"
 28 |     exit 0
 29 | fi
 30 | 
 31 | # =============================================================================

<write_to_file>
<path>scripts/update_assets.sh</path>
<content>#!/bin/bash
# =============================================================================
# update_assets.sh - Update assets from current system configuration
# =============================================================================
# This script copies your current system configuration back to the assets/
# directory to keep your backup in sync with your latest changes.
# =============================================================================

set -e

# Source common utilities
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
source "$SCRIPT_DIR/common.sh"

check_not_root
verify_backup_dir

log_section "Updating assets from system configuration..."

# =============================================================================
# Dotfiles
# =============================================================================
log_section "Updating dotfiles..."

# .zshrc
if [[ -f ~/.zshrc ]]; then
    cp ~/.zshrc "$BACKUP_DIR/.zshrc"
    log_success "Updated .zshrc"
fi

# .zshrc.enhanced (if exists and different from .zshrc)
if [[ -f ~/.zshrc.enhanced ]]; then
    cp ~/.zshrc.enhanced "$BACKUP_DIR/.zshrc.enhanced"
    log_success "Updated .zshrc.enhanced"
fi

# .bashrc
if [[ -f ~/.bashrc ]]; then
    cp ~/.bashrc "$BACKUP_DIR/.bashrc"
    log_success "Updated .bashrc"
fi

# .gitconfig
if [[ -f ~/.gitconfig ]]; then
    cp ~/.gitconfig "$BACKUP_DIR/.gitconfig"
    log_success "Updated .gitconfig"
fi

# =============================================================================
# Config Directories
# =============================================================================
log_section "Updating .config directories..."

ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config"

# Starship
if [[ -f ~/.config/starship.toml ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship"
    cp ~/.config/starship.toml "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship/starship.toml"
    log_success "Updated starship.toml"
fi
if [[ -d ~/.config/starship ]]; then
    cp -r ~/.config/starship/* "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/starship/" 2>/dev/null || true
    log_success "Updated starship config directory"
fi

# Atuin
if [[ -d ~/.config/atuin ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/atuin"
    cp -r ~/.config/atuin/* "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/atuin/" 2>/dev/null || true
    log_success "Updated atuin config"
fi

# Fastfetch
if [[ -d ~/.config/fastfetch ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fastfetch"
    # Copy config files but not the assets subdirectory (we handle jedi.png separately)
    find ~/.config/fastfetch -maxdepth 1 -type f -exec cp {} "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fastfetch/" \;
    log_success "Updated fastfetch config"
fi

# Fastfetch custom logo
if [[ -f ~/.config/fastfetch/assets/jedi.png ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/images"
    cp ~/.config/fastfetch/assets/jedi.png "$BACKUP_DIR/images/"
    log_success "Updated jedi.png"
fi

# Fish
if [[ -d ~/.config/fish ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fish"
    cp -r ~/.config/fish/* "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/fish/" 2>/dev/null || true
    log_success "Updated fish config"
fi

# Kitty
if [[ -d ~/.config/kitty ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty"
    cp -r ~/.config/kitty/* "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/kitty/" 2>/dev/null || true
    log_success "Updated kitty config"
fi

# Tmux
if [[ -d ~/.config/tmux ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/tmux"
    cp -r ~/.config/tmux/* "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/tmux/" 2>/dev/null || true
    log_success "Updated tmux config"
fi

# Yazi
if [[ -d ~/.config/yazi ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/yazi"
    cp -r ~/.config/yazi/* "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/yazi/" 2>/dev/null || true
    log_success "Updated yazi config"
fi

# Bat
if [[ -d ~/.config/bat ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/bat"
    cp -r ~/.config/bat/* "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/bat/" 2>/dev/null || true
    log_success "Updated bat config"
fi

# EasyEffects
if [[ -d ~/.config/easyeffects ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/easyeffects"
    cp -r ~/.config/easyeffects/* "$BACKUP_DIR/.config/easyeffects/" 2>/dev/null || true
    log_success "Updated easyeffects config"
fi

# =============================================================================
# VS Code
# =============================================================================
log_section "Updating VS Code configuration..."

VSCODE_USER_DIR="$HOME/.config/Code/User"

if [[ -d "$VSCODE_USER_DIR" ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode"
    
    # settings.json
    if [[ -f "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/settings.json" ]]; then
        cp "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/settings.json" "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/"
        log_success "Updated VS Code settings.json"
    fi
    
    # keybindings.json
    if [[ -f "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/keybindings.json" ]]; then
        cp "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/keybindings.json" "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/"
        log_success "Updated VS Code keybindings.json"
    fi
    
    # snippets
    if [[ -d "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/snippets" ]]; then
        ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/snippets"
        cp -r "$VSCODE_USER_DIR/snippets/"* "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/snippets/" 2>/dev/null || true
        log_success "Updated VS Code snippets"
    fi
    
    # Generate extensions list
    if check_command code; then
        code --list-extensions > "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/extensions.txt"
        log_success "Updated VS Code extensions.txt"
    fi
    
    # Kilo Code global storage
    KILO_CODE_STORAGE="$VSCODE_USER_DIR/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code"
    if [[ -d "$KILO_CODE_STORAGE" ]]; then
        ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/globalStorage"
        rm -rf "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/globalStorage/kilocode.kilo-code" 2>/dev/null || true
        cp -r "$KILO_CODE_STORAGE" "$BACKUP_DIR/vscode/globalStorage/"
        log_success "Updated Kilo Code global storage"
    fi
fi

# =============================================================================
# Godot
# =============================================================================
log_section "Updating Godot configuration..."

GODOT_CONFIG_DIR="$HOME/.config/godot"

if [[ -d "$GODOT_CONFIG_DIR" ]]; then
    ensure_dir "$BACKUP_DIR/godot"
    
    # Copy editor settings (find the most recent one)
    EDITOR_SETTINGS=$(find "$GODOT_CONFIG_DIR" -maxdepth 1 -name "editor_settings*.tres" -type f 2>/dev/null | head -1)
    if [[ -n "$EDITOR_SETTINGS" ]]; then
        cp "$EDITOR_SETTINGS" "$BACKUP_DIR/godot/"
        log_success "Updated Godot editor settings: $(basename "$EDITOR_SETTINGS")"
    fi
    
    # Copy other Godot config files
    for file in "$GODOT_CONFIG_DIR"/*.tres "$GODOT_CONFIG_DIR"/*.cfg; do
        if [[ -f "$file" ]]; then
            cp "$file" "$BACKUP_DIR/godot/" 2>/dev/null || true
        fi
    done
    
    # Copy recent_dirs if exists
    if [[ -f "$GODOT_CONFIG_DIR/recent_dirs" ]]; then
        cp "$GODOT_CONFIG_DIR/recent_dirs" "$BACKUP_DIR/godot/"
        log_success "Updated Godot recent_dirs"
    fi
fi

# =============================================================================
# Summary
# =============================================================================
log_section "Asset Update Complete!"
echo ""
echo "Updated assets in: $BACKUP_DIR"
echo ""
echo "Next steps:"
echo "  1. Review changes: git diff"
echo "  2. Stage changes: git add ."
echo "  3. Commit: git commit -m 'chore: update assets from system'"
echo ""
</content>
